required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of an Investigational Zoster Vaccine, in Subjects With a History of Herpes Zoster (V211-014)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Clinical Trial to Study the Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Zoster Vaccine Live in Subjects With a History of Herpes Zoster

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the investigational zoster vaccine, is generally well tolerated when administered to participants with a history of herpes zoster.

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine-related Serious Adverse Experiences (SAEs) for 28 Days Postvaccination
primary_outcome.description: SAEs are AEs at any dose that: Results in death or persistent/significant disability/incapacity; or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization or Is life threatening; or Is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or Is a cancer; or Is an overdose or Is an other important medical event

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The GMT of the VZV-specific antibody responses as measured by gpELISA (glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay) at the prespecified day ranges at prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) in VZV Antibody Titers From Prevaccination to 4 Weeks Postvaccination
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response at the prespecified day ranges prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

arm_group.description: Zoster vaccine live on Day 1 (Period 1), placebo on Week 4 (Period 2)
Placebo on Day 1 (Period 1), zoster vaccine live on Week 4 (Period 2)

intervention.description: 1 dose 0.65 mL/dose subcutaneous injection of zoster vaccine live
1 dose 0.65 mL/dose subcutaneous injection of placebo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults ≥ 50 years of age with a history of herpes zoster ≥ 5 years prior to enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergy to any vaccine component
- Prior receipt of a varicella or zoster vaccine
- Ability to defend against infection is suppressed by a medical condition or medication

results_reference.citation: Mills R, Tyring SK, Levin MJ, Parrino J, Li X, Coll KE, Stek JE, Schlienger K, Chan IS, Silber JL. Safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of zoster vaccine in subjects with a history of herpes zoster. Vaccine. 2010 Jun 7;28(25):4204-9. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2010.04.003. Epub 2010 Apr 21.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited at 9 sites in the United States. First patient enrolled: May-2006; Last patient last visit: July – 2007

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo
group.description: 0.65mL of Zoster vaccine live injected subcutaneously on Day 1 (Period 1) followed by 0.65mL of placebo injected subcutaneously at Week 4 (Period 2)

group.title: Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: 0.65mL of placebo injected subcutaneously on Day 1 (Period 1) followed by 0.65mL of Zoster vaccine live injected subcutaneously at Week 4 (Period 2)

participants_list.participants: One participant was lost between Period 1 and Period 2

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo
group.description: 0.65mL of Zoster vaccine live injected subcutaneously on Day 1 (Period 1) followed by 0.65mL of placebo injected subcutaneously at Week 4 (Period 2)

group.title: Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: 0.65mL of placebo injected subcutaneously on Day 1 (Period 1) followed by 0.65mL of Zoster vaccine live injected subcutaneously at Week 4 (Period 2)

outcome.title: Vaccine-related Serious Adverse Experiences (SAEs) for 28 Days Postvaccination
outcome.description: SAEs are AEs at any dose that: Results in death or persistent/significant disability/incapacity; or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization or Is life threatening; or Is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or Is a cancer; or Is an overdose or Is an other important medical event
outcome.population: All vaccinated participants were evaluated for safety. This was a crossover study. All participants received one dose each of ZOSTAVAX™ and placebo. Data below reflect SAEs reported after receipt of ZOSTAVAX™ or placebo.

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: Participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ in the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group (see participant flow section) are included

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received placebo in the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ Group (see participant flow section) are included.

measure.title: Vaccine-related Serious Adverse Experiences (SAEs) for 28 Days Postvaccination
measure.description: SAEs are AEs at any dose that: Results in death or persistent/significant disability/incapacity; or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization or Is life threatening; or Is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or Is a cancer; or Is an overdose or Is an other important medical event
measure.population: All vaccinated participants were evaluated for safety. This was a crossover study. All participants received one dose each of ZOSTAVAX™ and placebo. Data below reflect SAEs reported after receipt of ZOSTAVAX™ or placebo.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
outcome.description: The GMT of the VZV-specific antibody responses as measured by gpELISA (glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay) at the prespecified day ranges at prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: Participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ in both, the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group (see participant flow section) are included.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received placebo (at Day 1) in Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group. Participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ at (Day 1) in the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group were excluded to avoid a possible carry-over effect of ZOSTAVAX™ on immunogenicity measurements.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
measure.description: The GMT of the VZV-specific antibody responses as measured by gpELISA (glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay) at the prespecified day ranges at prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) in VZV Antibody Titers From Prevaccination to 4 Weeks Postvaccination
outcome.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response at the prespecified day ranges prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: Participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ in both, the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group are included. In addition, 5 participants from the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group were excluded in the prevaccination summaries (since their specimens were damaged or collected out of day range), and are not in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants included in this analysis were those who received Placebo in Placebo /ZOSTAVAX™ group (on Day 1). Participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ in the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group were excluded in order to avoid a possible carry-over effect of ZOSTAVAX™ on immunogenicity measurements. In addition, 5 participants from the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group were excluded in the prevaccination summaries (since their specimens were damaged or collected out of day range), and are not in the analysis.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) in VZV Antibody Titers From Prevaccination to 4 Weeks Postvaccination
measure.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response at the prespecified day ranges prevaccination and 4 weeks postvaccination

reported_events.desc: Injection-site adverse experiences (AEs), rashes, oral temperatures (if the participant felt febrile), and other AEs were recorded by the participant on a Vaccination Report Card which was reviewed by the study site personnel at the end of each 28-day follow-up period. The participants at risk are ITT population with follow-up.

group.title: ZOSTAVAX™
group.description: All participants that received ZOSTAVAX™ from both, the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™ group. Two participants that received ZOSTAVAX™ were lost to follow up and not included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: All participants that received Placebo in both, the ZOSTAVAX™ / Placebo group and the Placebo / ZOSTAVAX™. Five participants that received placebo were lost to follow up and not included in the analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
